speak;Garcia;That reminds me of the Battle of Western Keep.|Twenty soldiers surrounded me, and I was down to my last axe.
speak;Gerik;Twenty, you say?|Not bad for a forest villager.
speak;Garcia;*laughs heartily*|Former Renais Army Captain, mind you!|What's your best story, Desert Tiger?
speak;Gerik;Hmm...|Once faced thirty mercenaries in the Jehanna dunes.|With nothing but a broken sword and an empty canteen.
speak;Garcia;Thirty?|With a broken sword?
speak;Gerik;*nods*|The desert sun is a harsh mistress.|Makes men desperate.
speak;Garcia;Well, there was this time in Grado...|Forty Imperial soldiers had me cornered in a ravine.
speak;Gerik;*raises eyebrow*|Forty, is it now?
speak;Garcia;Indeed!|And it was raining. Mud up to my knees.
speak;Gerik;That's impressive, though...|I did once face fifty bandits while protecting a caravan.
speak;Garcia;Fifty?|Were you alone in this endeavor?
speak;Gerik;Completely alone.|My men were escorting the civilians to safety.
speak;Garcia;You know...|I remember a skirmish where sixty wyvern riders descended from the clouds...
speak;Gerik;Sixty wyvern riders?|*laughs*|And I suppose you fought them off with a kitchen knife?
speak;Garcia;*chuckles*|Well, it was a particularly sharp kitchen knife!
speak;Gerik;*laughs harder*|Next you'll tell me you fought a hundred men with a wooden spoon!
speak;Garcia;*roars with laughter*|And you'll claim two hundred with nothing but a stern glare!
speak;Gerik;*wipes tear from eye*|Ah, Garcia...|It's good to share war stories with someone who understands.
speak;Garcia;Indeed it is, Gerik.|The young ones think we're just old men telling tall tales.
speak;Gerik;Maybe we are...|Just a little.
speak;Garcia;*chuckles*|Just a little.
